pullRequest.body:
Define a Jacobian point representative over a ring `R` as the type `Fin 3 -> R`, and its equivalence class `PointClass` as a quotient by the usual weighted scaling relation. Define the analogous `equation` and `nonsingular` predicates on `Fin 3 -> F` over a field `F`, and lift `nonsingular` to `PointClass`. This also has minimal API (e.g. it's missing many of the `equation` lemmas) as most computations should ideally be done using the affine API.

This is the first in a series of four PRs leading to #9405 and is analogous to #9416 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Thanks!
The same question about `Projectivization` as in the PR about projective coords applies here as well.
This will be discussed in the projective coordinates PR.

These instances are not defeq or even prop-eq to the existing instances on `Fin 3 â†’ R`. We should consider either make them defs (and explicitly invoke the MulAction instance in the definition of PointSetoid), or create a type synonym of  `Fin 3 â†’ R`. I have the impression that `private instance` might still fire outside of this file, and you need `attribute [local instance]` to prevent that. Can you check whether it's the case? If these instances only fire with an `open scoped Jacobian` command, that would be good enough.
Good point. I moved it into a `WeierstrassCurve.Jacobian` namespace and made it scoped. Now it seems to fire only when `WeierstrassCurve.Jacobian` is opened.
This should be iff rather than eq.

```suggestion
lemma equiv_of_Z_eq_zero {P Q : Fin 3 â†’ F} (hP : W.nonsingular P) (hQ : W.nonsingular Q) (hPz : P z = 0)
```
similarly for the others. The lemmas with 0 and 1 in their names are on a list to be renamed, see #10077.
Sure. I made a similar change `X_eq` -> `Xeq` etc in the `Affine` file so we'd have to change all of that one day.

Some nonterminal simps here and the behavior is a bit nonpredictable; the first `simp` results in `Â¬0 = 3 âˆ¨ Â¬1 = -1 âˆ¨ Â¬W.aâ‚ = 0` while the second results in `Â¬3 = 0 âˆ¨ Â¬Y ^ 3 = -Y ^ 3 âˆ¨ Â¬W.aâ‚ = 0` (the order of 3 and 0 is changed). However, if this breaks it's probably not hard to figure out what linear combination to use by inspecting the simp'd expressions. Here's a slight generalization to the second proof:
```suggestion
lemma nonsingular_zero [Nontrivial R] : W.nonsingular ![1, 1, 0] :=
  (W.nonsingular_iff ![1, 1, 0]).mpr âŸ¨W.equation_zero,
    by simp; by_contra! h; exact one_ne_zero <| by linear_combination -h.1 - h.2.1âŸ©

lemma nonsingular_zero' [IsReduced R] {Y : R} (hy : Y â‰  0) :
    W.nonsingular ![Y ^ 2, Y ^ 3, 0] :=
  (W.nonsingular_iff ![Y ^ 2, Y ^ 3, 0]).mpr âŸ¨W.equation_zero' Y, by
    simp; contrapose! hy; exact IsNilpotent.eq_zero âŸ¨4, by linear_combination -hy.1 - Y * hy.2.1âŸ©âŸ©
```
Similar to the projective file, I think we can relegate this to a future PR.

```suggestion
  one_smul _ := by simp only [smul_fin3, Units.val_one, one_pow, one_mul, â† fin3_def]
  mul_smul u v P := by simp only [smul_fin3, Units.val_mul, mul_pow, mul_assoc]; matrix_simp
```
(untested)

I've never written non-trivial tactics before but wouldn't it be nice if there's a way to combine `matrix_simp` with other `simp` lemmas? So something like `matrix_simp [smul_fin3, ...]` or `simp only [smul_fin3, ...] using matrix_simp`...

If I understand correctly, you want to add a fixed list of lemmas to a `simp only` call. I tried my luck on LMSys Chatbot Arena, and Claude-2.1 gave [this answer](https://gist.github.com/alreadydone/2905095a12464b3e7ff9ffeaf3f556d6) which makes sense but is in Lean 3. I then asked Perplexity and it came up with [Lean 4 code](https://www.perplexity.ai/search/In-Lean-4-U7RNZO29QSeauFfVpNqumA?s=c) after reading documentation but I wouldn't expect it to work out of the box.
Yes, thanks! This is not too important right now, but in the future I plan to combine all the macros common to the `EllipticCurve` files, and will see what I can get out of this.
